text: 18.47 In accordance with Part 4, development will be expected to demonstrate that it will enhance and not negatively affect the borough’s publicly accessible open space, including the Lee Valley Regional Park (consisting of East India Dock Basin and linear towpaths along the River Lea Navigation, Hertford Union Canal and Limehouse Cut) the Lea River Park (including the Leaway) and TfL’s Lea Valley Walk initiative. 18.48 The Lee Valley Regional Park forms an important part of the borough’s green grid and water spaces network and has the potential to contribute to creating healthy and liveable communities, particularly where links into this network can be enhanced and complemented with new open space delivered as part of development. The Lee Valley Regional Park Authority is a statutory authority, with responsibilities to either provide directly or work with partners to provide facilities BIODIVERSITY AND OPEN SPACE
